credit.name: MatrixDB Support
credit.note: Professor at University Lyon 1, head of a team working on structure-interaction-function relationships of the extracellular matrix and extracellular matrix interaction networks.

description: It is a database focused on interactions established by extracellular proteins and polysaccharides. It takes into account the multimeric nature of several extracellular protein families for the curation of interactions, and reports interactions with individual polypeptide chains or with multimers, considered as permanent complexes.
name: MatrixDB

publication.note: The first full description of  MatrixDB as a member of the International Molecular Exchange consortium (IMEx), which has  adopted the PSI-MI standards for the curation and the exchange of interaction data.
The publication reports the update of MattrixDB content, the design of a new navigator and expanded functionalities.

The publication reports the update of MatrixDB content and the development of new functionalities focused on glycosaminoglycans (GAGs) (cross-references of GAG sequences to the GlyTouCan database, representation of GAG sequences in IUPAC, GlycoCT and SNFG formats and the GAG Builder online tool to build 3D models of GAG sequences from GlycoCT codes). The database schema has been improved to represent n-ary experiments. Gene expression data, imported from Expression Atlas, quantitative ECM proteomic datasets and a new visualization tool of the 3D structures of biomolecules have been added.
